# 
#

I am a Professor of Economics at Galatasaray University. Previously, I was a Professor of Economics at Bahçeşehir University and worked as a consultant for the TÜSİAD-Sabancı University Competitiveness Forum. I received my PhD from the University of Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne and did my postdoctoral training at the University of Montreal.

My research focuses on firm dynamics, with a special interest in SME challenges, innovation, productivity, and labor markets. I also work on short-run GDP growth forecasting.

My consulting clients have included the World Bank and the Turkish Statistical Institute. I am also an experienced instructor of the R programming language.
